Reviews.Title: “Hotel was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Lana M
Reviews.Content: We went B&B to hotel, breakfast was great, rooms were very good and all amenities very good. Very handy to all bus and train routes

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms, unfriendly staff and waaaay out in a bland residential borough”
Reviews.Author: Alberto S
Reviews.Content: Where to start; worst problem is probably that the company advertises with it's central location and even mentions on Expedia that it's located in the Mitte district... Don't be fooled, it's not. It's a 15 minute walk to nowhere, though at nowhere you at least find a subway station. Still, the neighborhood itself is amazingly uninteresting and appalling, ie ugly and at night full of drunks on streetcorners. Next up, the horrible, ill-making smell which for some reason comes from every possible bathroom in the hotel. It was explained as some summer-based problem with river water coming up (?!?); Still, summer was gone and the smell remained. Regardless, how could one accept any excuse?? Rooms only have double twins, which leaves me wondering: is there actually anyone aside from a bunch of students travelling together that rather sleep on a smallish twin bed?? Minibar is advertised as complimentary, though you are chargest for every refill (last time I checked, that was not the definition of free). Breakfast is so expensive, you might expect caviar and champagne. While the selection is definitely decent, it in no way compares to the outrageous prices. In general, food appears to come at a price which is quadruple it's value. Staff is mostly uncompetent, albeit somet are somewhat friendly. However, the front office manager is probably the most unfriendly, uninterested, arrogant, rude and uninterested person in the world. The kind of person that intends to make you feel sorry for any inquiry you might have dared to ask. Anything positive about this hotel? Well, the wellness center is ok, and they did make an effort to be trendy (endresult however, they failed somewhat). Well that, oh yeah, and they are right on the banks off the Spree, however if you are not a river fetishist, this will not make up for all the things it lacks. Stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: TEDF81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adrema at the end of July 2011- the hotel is ok, staff are friendly however location is not ideal! The hotel itself was good, breakfast was nice and the restaurant served good food.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful room with a view of the Spree greeted us.”
Reviews.Author: Retiredapril11
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and will go back there when we return to Berlin. The view was lovely and the hotel staff was certainly accommodating. Everything was spotless and there were many extras.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel but there is something missing...”
Reviews.Author: Catherine70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice if you want to see the real Berlin. I mean it's not in the city centre but it's very easily accessible with one bus in 15 minutes. Its location gives you the opportunity to see the real berliners in their real surrounding, which gave a lot of great moments. But what was missing from the hotel was the attention to details. For example, there were traces and stains here and there and the curtains seemed to be quite old. It was a pity for such a nice hotel. Of course I would stay again, although I would look to other hotels too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jepangs
Reviews.Content: I absolutely not recommend this unless you need only bed for few days. I stayed in Adrema Gold Inn Hotel for 3 weeks and I changed my room 3 times due to out of order facility. 2 times was aircondition was working with not cold air but hot air, It was middle of Summber (June) During 3 weeks, Internet was availible for only 3days but any employee didn't care of it. Whenever I requested repairment status of internet, they said only for 3 weeks. "I don't know but soon It will be availible" Most worst thing was employee's attitude. When I started to complain for internet service (not availible), They voice wasn't kind at all. I had feel like I tried to make them disturbing make a noise. For proving malfunction of internet service. I had to show by my laptop computer . Of course, for 3 days I had to explain to every different employee from begin of problem because those each receiptionists never ever share information of guest claim or message. Only a solution which they gave, Recommending to connect internet not in my room but front of receiption whenever I need. I stay 5 hotels in germany but this hotel was terrbile one but others were wonderful. If you want alternatives, I want to recommend Abion Hotel about 10 minutes far from there.

Reviews.Title: “A Well Thought Out Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jchan2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a quiet area of Berlin which made it easy to relax and catch some sleep after a long day touring the city. Although it was a bit far from the nearest U-Bahn station, it was close to several bus stops that would take you to Hauptbahnhof and points beyond. The rooms were always clean and well laid-out, the bathroom easy to use. The staff was friendly and helpful in arranging for internet access, and it's free in the lobby if you just ask. The neighborhood it's in is nice and has some shops, though food places close early. Overall, we quite enjoyed our stay. Between the clean rooms, helpful staff, and quiet location, we were able to be well rested and relaxed during our stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Was there on a business trip and will return for vacation”
Reviews.Author: wokie67
Reviews.Content: The rooms are rather comfy. Clever bathroom solution. The breakfast buffet offers a broad variety that does not get boring at all. The meals are tasty - there is a great chef in the kitchen. There is a whole wellness level for all wellness enthusiasts.

Reviews.Title: “You have to Iron behind counter”
Reviews.Author: zeeshm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok - reasonably clean, but not immaculate. The rooms were basic but served a purpose. I guess you get what you pay for and this place wasn't ridiculously expensive as we got a corporate rate through work. THe strangest thing i found was when I asked for a Iron in my room - they said they didnt have irons in rooms due to health and safety (ok that makes sense many hotels dont) but they had an iron and an ironing board that I could use that they kept behind reception?! I was like ok, interesting - i'm a business travller having to iron my crisp white shirts behind your front desk. This aside the staff were very warm, accomodating and helpful and the hotel itself was in a reasonable location (a bit further out from the centre, but not far from the main station).

Reviews.Title: “nice, but religous propaganda and expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: hajons
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really clean, nice, friendly staff and nicely situated next to Spree. However, like most German hotels they have religous propaganda on the rooms in the form of bibels. Also, their ISP does not support any roaming partners, and there are no nearby open wifis.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: BurnleyAussie
Reviews.Content: We went to stay in Berlin and chose the Adrema because we got a good rate on night and reviews were good. The only the bad thing is it was a little bit far out but the train station is about a 5-10min walk. The rest was absolutely awesome, the rooms were really clean and spacious. The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel itself was clean and there were no faults. The breakfast was the best thing. I've stayed at a lot of 5 star resorts and 3 and 4 star hotels most the time when I have had breakfast its not quite there. But at the Hotel Adrema they hit the nail on the head. I cannot fault anything, Muesli, Fresh Fruit, Full English and also some hamburger things that were awesome. Cereals, Croissants and other pastries just was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: calgarytraveler0
Reviews.Content: Found it on the net. Was initially concerned about the location potentially being too far from the places we wanted to see in Berlin. Great experience started with reception staff giving us a room at 10:30 AM which was many hours before the official check-in time. After a long flight from Calgary that was greatly appreciated. During our ten day stay we found everybody, from the front desk to the restaurant and room service, to be extremely professional, pleasant and helpful. They all spoke very good English which was a great help for us as non-German speakers. Requested additional pillows were in the room even before we reached our room (#224). The room was good size with a couple sofas and a desk. Free in-room safe was great to have. Very clean/spotless room and the bathroom(bright).Both very good size. Towels were good size and plenty in number which sometimes is a concern in Europe. River view from our room was great. Barges/cruise boats going by made it really a pleasure to look out the window. Location was great. Away from the busy/ noisy areas. Easy access to all the popular sites by public transport. Only 4Km from Brandenburg gate.For us that was an easy walking distance. Less than 30 min to Alexander Platz (Bus/Train). Nearest bus stop was about 50 yards (take #245 to Main Railway station and from there to anywhere in Berlin within minutes by S/U Bahn or train). Lunch boxes were ready for us at check out time (5 AM) . That was a very nice touch. Recommend reserving the room with breakfast rather than paying for breakfast after arrival (typical German- with a lot of hot /cold choices w/meat/eggs/cheeses/ fruits/yogurt/cereal etc, etc) ). We found that to be an excellent value. There are two nearby mid size grocery stores (less than 10 minute walk) with lots of fresh fruit and good bakeries. Reception Staff is quite knowledgeable about nearby restaurants and recommendations were right on. Walked around even after dark with no concern about safety. Air conditioning was appropriate to provided just enough relief from heat without making the room freezing cold. Free use of an high speed internet terminal at a private corner in the lobby (with color printer/no extra charge for printing) was greatly appreciated. All in all Adrema is a great value and if we make another trip to Berlin it will be our definite #1 choice. The hotel is close to Tagel (TXL) airport and taxi fare was(as of yesterday ) 12-13 euros (depending on the traffic). We purchased seven day transit pass for 26 euros per person for unlimited use and definitely got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Fine quiet hotel but no easy connections.”
Reviews.Author: Agriogatos
Reviews.Content: This hotel located in a quiet quarter is a bit away from metro and attractions. The rooms were very clean and well equipped. Those that overlook the river are more attractive. With fine weather you can eat or drink your beer in the open across the river. Staff in general helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Marinillo
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and tidy. I would not recommend Adrema Hotel to friends because it's located in an area not well connected to the centre of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: Nice alternative to a number of more expensive places in Berlin. Nicely located by the river but a bit far from the center of Berlin. The staff upgraded me to a small suite (I booked a superior room, which was quite cheap in my opinion for a week-end in Berlin). The room was modern and clean, and the bathroom quite large. The breakfast was quite good, while a bit expensive given Berlin standards.

Reviews.Title: “Adrema's a dream”
Reviews.Author: Glesgagal84
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed in the Hotel Adrema for 5 nights at the end of July. Found the hotel to be very modern, clean and stylish - well worth what we paid for it (£50/night inc bfast). The hotel room was nice, good size and nice view of the river spree. The bathroom was unusual with the glass walls but i though this was a good touch. Limited TV channels as per in european hotels (2 english channels). Breakfast served at the hotel was very nice and plenty to of choice to suit everyone. The location of the hotel was not the best, rather out of the way of the main areas (mitte etc) although excellent transport system with the buses (across the road) and Subway (10 minutes away). Would recommend if you dont mind using the public transport! TIP - purchase the 3 day travel card for 20 euros from reception!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great facilities, mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: dipl0matic0
Reviews.Content: We spent a thoroughly pleasant week at the Adrema. Our room on the 6th floor was not huge, but comfortable and had a stunning view over the river Spree. The bathroom - including the toilet - is separated from the main room only by etched glass walls, which some people will finde uncomfortable. Highlights include the sleek, stylish design and the great fitness/spa. The location is fine if your main points of interest are in the western parts of Berlin. To get to the center or the hip areas of Kreuzberg and Prenzlauer Berg you will need advanced skills at navigating the public transportation grid - or get used to 20 minute walks to the closest S-Bahn station. This hotel gets a lot of weddings and other noisy events, so were glad to be on one of the upper floors. And the reception was often understaffed, leading to annoying waits and unanswered phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location by the river Spree”
Reviews.Author: LuckaT
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, perfect location for morning jogging by the river Spree:), easy access to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Adrema hotel in June while I was on a business trip, it was a great stay. Staff is so professional and served my needs. Very modern and well designed. At check in, staff were so professional, polite and paid attention to all details. I had an early flight and when I arrived at around 8 a.m, receptionist decided to give me a room although it was too early to check in, they understood that I had an overnight flight from Canada. My only concern is when it got busy in the evening; it was difficult to get my room service order placed, when I complained, room service explained to me in a very professional way that it was too busy and convinced me until I felt they made their point. I suitable for business travelers as well as for one lesuire. Lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: andy_goreing
Reviews.Content: Very nice, very modern hotel slightly out of the centre. We got around with public transport and this wasn't a problem. Rooms were great. The bed was big and very comfortable. Our bathroom was very funky with a glass wall. The staff were all helpful. All the staff we met spoke english. Breakfast was nice but really expensive. We preferred to go to a little cafe 20 yards away and have coffee and a croissant for a couple of euros. There are a number of restaurants within a 10 minute walk for an evening meal. We booked this as a secret hotel through lastminute and it was good value

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel to explore a great city”
Reviews.Author: Musicaltourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adrema for 3 nights having booked a "Top Secret Hotel Deal" with lastminute and were very pleased. Clean, friendly and good value. The City centre was in walkable distance through the lovely tiergarten and along the Strasee des 17 Juni towards the Brandenburg gate. Two S Bahn stations (Tiergarten and Bellvue) and a U bahn station (Hansaplatz) are even closer and we returned via these in the evening. It was also convinient for visiting the many attractions in Charlottenburg. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful - we were delighted to be allowed to check in on arrival much earlier than the stated time - after a 2.30am start a power nap at lunch time was greatly appreciated. The rooms were fairly standard, clean and modern and unremarkable. Slightly disturbed by the strange "spy holes" (Circles of clear rather than misted glass) between the bathroom and bedroom? Overall a good hotel for a good price, contributed towards a very enjoyable break.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear!”
Reviews.Author: wearyteacher
Reviews.Content: Lastminute.com say this " Adrema Hotel - 4* - Berlin Feel the well-known Berliner Luft - the air of Berlin, while staying at this stylish hotel right in the heart of this amazing city. ..." This is quite simply NOT TRUE. The hotel is a LONG way from the city centre attractions, and relies on either a tedious bus trip or a serious taxi ride. Not suitable for nipping back to or dropping shopping off, it takes at least 25 minutes each way. And, whilst the staff were fine, EVERYTHING is charged extra, even the robes. There was also a slightly defensive air about everything, as though actually they knew you weren't in the part of town you wanted to be in, but they were doing their best. The room was fine, (although there was an interesting vanity unit stuck in the middle with waterless taps?) and it was clean. However, the view was not good, and the room was overlooked by a large office block - hey, we could see them so they must have been able to see us! And there's a warning not to open the window because of spiders...?

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiefyLancasterUK
Reviews.Content: We'd just spent 3 days in a hotel in Docklands London.To put it mildly for £70 a night it was basic to say the least. So we were over the moon that the deluxe room at the Adrema costing roughly the same was sowell appointed. Thoroughly modern with an excellent bathroom and immaculately clean. We had the buffet on the Saturday night which was good value for roughly £10. The service was superb and genuine. We used Bellevue station which was about 20 minutes walk away, Two stops and we were in central Berlin. Thooughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “berlin in october”
Reviews.Author: ZenicaImagination
Reviews.Content: nice hotel,good position,easy to reach the center,clean and comfortable rooms,nice restoran,good and fresh food,friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “had a brill time”
Reviews.Author: raceace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as my husband was running the Marathon, which incidently ran right past the hotel door!! On the first day we walked into the centre of kurfurstendamm area which took us around 20mins but we then realised that the number 245 bus stopped outside the door of the hotel and took us straight to the zoological gardens. These buses were approx every 10mins. The hotel itself was wonderful with great size of room and modern glass bathroom. We ate in the restaurant one night as they laid on a pasta party for marathon runners which was fantastic value and the food was wonderful. We found both reception staff and waiters to be very curteous and helpful and being frequent travellers abroad my Husband and I would certainly go back to this hotel. We found that the restaurants surrounding the Hotel were very cheap with 2 courses wine and coffee costing around £18 for two people!

Reviews.Title: “What a place”
Reviews.Author: TaffSwansea_Wales
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at the Adrema hotel in two years, it really is a lovely hotel. The staff there are so helpful and friendly,the rooms are very comfortable and clean.. and the restaurant serves some fantastic food.Just to sit on the terrace bar and watch the boats sail by on the river Spree is worth the visit alone.The location of the hotel makes it so easy to visit all the major tourist sites.we will be back to enjoy it all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near 4 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: ashramsey
Reviews.Content: Expecting 4 stars, my girlfriend and I were very dissapointed when we were met with such rude and unnattentive reception staff, followed by a small room with a massive desk???, a shower that kept changing temperatures, and the exuberant hidden cost (15euro/day) of internet (the 4 star hotels I've previously stayed in do not charge for this). The location we thought was just too far from Berlin's hot spots, and the transports (and I do rate Berlin's transport system), was very limited, particularly trains. Perhaps if we had more time we could explore the area more, but from what we saw, it was pretty, but not really happening. Other problems included again rubbish service from reception when asking and clarifying information about Berlin, including waiting for reception to call back a 3rd time to organise a massage and then after 30minutes, having to follow this up to cancel, poor circulation of air in the corridoors, and ridiculously heavy doors to open throughout the hotel. But it's not all dissapointment. The breakfast was fantastic, and we recommend their croissants!!! We were on the road side and the traffic was inaudible. If this hotel really wants to be considered 4 stars, it needs a little more attention to details of comfort, a lot more attention to professionalism of reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: mzh140
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Adrema. The rooms are very modern and beautifully designed, especially the bathrooms. Everything was exceptionally clean. The river view wasn't quite as spectacular as I'd hoped - I'd imagined being able to see a long stretch of it and across the rooftops, but it's quite a built-up area so you can't see all that far. Still, it was definitely nice to have, as opposed to just looking at buildings. In our room we had a flatscreen tv with remote, which also doubled as an internet terminal (though there is one in reception which you seem to be able to use for free). There was also a hairdryer, and (quite expensive) minibar and snacks. It was a real shame not being able to make tea and coffee in your room, though. As is common in Europe, our double room had two single beds pushed together. The beds were a bit on the soft side and gave me backache, and the pilows were very very soft and sort of formless, making it hard to sit up in bed. But the linen was all plain white and crisp and fresh. The breakfast is extra at 14 Euros, and another 3 Euros to have it in your room, which we did on our last day and I have to say it was worth it. It was very generous and our breakfast for one easily fed two people. There is a little greasy spoon on the corner where you can get a cheaper breakfast if you like, and a supermarket and Burger King five minutes' walk or so away (the restaurant is closed on Sundays). The Adrema is a little bit out-of-the-way, but it's only a short walk to either Tiergarten or Bellevue S-Bahns, or you can walk through Tiergarten or along the Spree into the central area of Berlin. The staff at the Adrema mostly spoke English and were very friendly and helpful. Reception was open 24 hours a day, which was useful when we wanted to get a cab at 2am. Although there was a bit of a feel of a business hotel about it, with a few conference-goers going in and out, we were there for a romantic weekend and it was fine for us. I'd definitely recommend it - in terms of value for money, we got a lot of designer bang for our bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Not very good location”
Reviews.Author: gillycooke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 14-18 Dec. Lovely Hotel but not a very good location as well as some others. We stayed on the 6th floor over looking the river (request this when booking) and had a great view of the city. It is situated in the suburbs with a lot of turkish restaurants. the area dosen't feel safe when you get off the bus but actually is ok. The breakfast is 14 euro a day but if you come out of the hotel and turn left on the corner is wee cafe that does a a very cheap breakfast for no more than 5.50 euro. If you need instructions on how to get to the hotel phone up and they will fax them to you. Once you get the hang of travelling to and from here its grand. I would certainly stay in the hotel again as I know how to get to and from no problem now but if you can get somewhere nearer to the trains stations P.S. There is no kettle amenities in the room that was our downside.

Reviews.Title: “Good river views”
Reviews.Author: EEYORETIGGERR
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice design hotel located slightly outside the city centre. The hotel is located on the river and a large proportion of the rooms have river views. The rooms are very ‘trendy’ with a glass fronted bathroom and the hotel restaurant is excellent (definitely recommended.) We got a really good deal on the hotel through last minute and if you can get a deal I would definitely recommend staying there however it is a distance to the centre (although it is quite a nice walk), the hotel lacks atmosphere and has no real lobby area + you have to pay to use the gym/spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Details matter”
Reviews.Author: genene
Reviews.Content: Plus points: Good beds, power showers, modern design, excellent breakfast, spacious rooms. Negatives: Rude check in staff, overbooking (4 while when we arrived), bad German house music in the bar and restaurant, TV didn't work, truly awful cocktails. General : This hotel could be great if they employed better staff and paid attention to the details that matter, a great hotel isn't just about good design.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: RobynR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Adrema for three nights in July and were just overwhelmed when we saw the hotel. We found our room to be beautifully modern, bed very very comfortable, all extremely clean, very well priced and in an OK location with friendly, helpful staff. Our room faced the road and we had no trouble whatsoever with traffic noise. The air conditioning was really needed as it was an extremely hot July and our room had full sun most of the day. We chose to walk to and from the underground which took about half an hour, and although it was very hot in Berlin it was an easy walk. There are many restaurants near the hotel and a beautiful cafe on the corner with the best coffee and most beautiful pastries. The open topped double decked bus tours really are a must and we also did a walking tour of the city which was exceptional. The Adrema is a fantastic hotel and if given the chance we'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: 2bTraveling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic value for the money. It is modern and clean. It had a very comfortable bed. The glass wall on the bathroom was a little funky (especially since I was traveling with my 15 year old son) but we got over it. The location isn't near anything but taxis are reasonable. We'd just take one to a location we'd want to see and then catch one back at the end of the day. The breakfast was extra but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PinkMoon77
Reviews.Content: This whole trip was a birthday gift for my boyfriend so I did do my research. The images online of the hotel looked fab so when i got there to say I was shocked was an understatement...The hotel is extremely impressive. The initial greeting from the staff on booking in was so polite and the hotel itself appeared very modern and clean. We stayed on the 3rd floor which was fine. Again, very very clean and well lit with lighting sensors so that you dont have to faff around looking for switches. The room was beautiful. It was absolutly fantastic and again so clean. Very modern. The staff in the bar / resturant were lovely. Greeted us everytime we entered and couldnt do enough for us. They went out of their way to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. Very Polite and really made an effort. we had breakfast at the hotel only which again, was fit for a king twice over... The hotel was located pretty central and unless your really idel and cant be bothered to absorb your surroundings then really walking to the main attractions like The Brandenburg gate should not be an issue. It probably took about 20-30 mins to walk Tiergarten and it was really pleasent along the way. Local cabs will stop for you at the hotel location - just thumb them - and they will tell you the places to go. All in all this hotel is finely located along the River Spree and is dead romantic in the bar on the evenings when it gets dark and there is little noise. The staff are great and we will definatly be going back there again.!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms; OK location, Ok services”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel, we were quite impressed. The rooms are beautiful, clean and modern so we were quite happy. However, there is a restaurant on the first floor, our room was on the second floor. The first night you could hear the music from the restaurant but it wasn't too loud or disruptive. The second night was awful! There was a private party that lasted until almost 3AM complete with karaoke to crappy American songs and traditional Jewish songs. I can't even describe how loud it was! I wouldn't stay there again without asking if there are any private parties – or I'd just research a better place to stay. This hotel was a short bus ride to the Zoo station, but the bus only came at 20 minute intervals so it wasn't very convenient. Don't stop at this hotel - I would suggest continuing your search for another hotel in Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Adrema Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gotzkowskystrasse 20 - 21, 10555 Berlin, Germany
